column4: I'm using 1001px, but with xubuntu 10.10. I've enconuntered some very weird wlan problems.
I'm typing here :)
not really. About 30% of times, I can't connect to my home network with "authentication fail" or somesuch. However, works with every other network, and every other computer works with my home wlan.
also, it works like a charm on window 7 dualboot side...
One thing you might want to try is use ndiswrapper to use windows side wlan drivers on linux. However, didn't help for me.
Also, the ath9k driver (or, well, "kernel module" may be the correct term) has some parameters you can try messing around with to see if there's a difference.
ath9k is the driver linux, well at least 10.10, uses for the 1001px wlan card.
how do I know the parameters?
I wish I knew if there was one :) Let me check the parameters, I have the old notes from when I tried to troubleshoot the wlan isuue.
modinfo ath9k shows the parameters available. actually there weren't that many, it seems only "debug" and "nohwcrypt"
looks like we're not the only ones having this problem
yeah. I've given up on it myself, when I can't connect to home net, I'll just use GPRS via my phone. :)
I've had my headphones work ok.
though I'm using mostly bluetooth headphones, so I haven't tested extensively.
but that's not a problem if you start to expect them to be where unity has them. I mean that goes away once you get used to it?
I've used Windows a lot, and I'm on linux/ubuntu now since 6.04 or so
probably some tab auto completion
I'm not arguing unity is good. I haven't tried it much yet. But I don't like to stick to old models only because of familiarity. THat's only me, of course.
did you try using the win driver via ndiswrapper btw? Any luck with that?
iirc I used the ones that came with windows.
there's a external program to generate steps automatically. something that had "monkey" in its name :D
works pretty nice too. Nothing dramatic of course, but I've had fun with it.
